body:
@becker33 @tgamblin @tldahlgren 

I would like to filter output of `spack test list` by installed specs instead of seeing all the specs with the spec syntax. 

### Rationale

Output of `spack test list` can be quite long it makes it easier to find specs that one may want to test. 

@tgamblin @becker33 @tldahlgren 

Right now i have to grep for specs to see what is available

```
shahzebsiddiqui@iris19:~> spack test list | grep libxml2 | head -n 3
gahbtdd libxml2@2.9.10
cqhyezh libxml2@2.9.10
zmxcvsn libxml2@2.9.10
```

What i'd like to do is say `spack test list libxml2` or `spack test list libxml2@2.9.10` or any of the spec syntax.

Right now i can't do that since this argument is not available

```
shahzebsiddiqui@iris19:~> spack test list libxml2
==> Error: unrecognized arguments: libxml2
```

I am using the e4s-21.02 tag at JLSE.
title: list output of "spack test list" by installed specs
